Job Title: Corinth Reman ECB Assembly Logistics II (1st shift)

Location: Corinth, MS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Career Area

Operations

Job Description

 Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. 

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

 CATERPILLAR REMANUFACTURING 

Do you have a passion for helping customers and supporting a sustainable solution? Since 1973, Cat Reman has helped bring the value at the core of every Cat product back to life. Customers look to us to provide a high-quality solution that is good for their business - and promotes sustainability. It's important to us to deliver. Our team is full of industry leaders. Together, following common values, we share a passion for delivering sustainability benefits that help the company contribute to a circular economy. It’s rewarding work, with an inspiring team, where every contribution matters.

  Our Caterpillar Remanufacturing Division currently has an opening for a Logistics II position located in the     Corinth, MS     facility   . This position will perform the same job functions as the Logistics I position with more focus on transactional items including ordering parts and material. The job scope for Logistics II positions will include maintaining POU (Point of Use) material availability, provide direction to Logistics I operators as needed, and identify parts/locations.

Job Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To 

 Work in a fast-paced, safety and quality focused environment  May be required to use an overhead hoist to move large components  May require utilizing heavy equipment, reach trucks, sit-down forklifts, overhead cranes, and/or electric pallet jack to move parts in and out of area  May perform material handling, unloading parts from tubs or baskets according to production schedule  May perform order filling, processing, storing/ picking of parts, materials, equipment and supplies  May require checking incoming material and entering data  Cross training in other positions up to and including salary grade 3 may be required, based upon basic qualifications and physical requirements being met Examples of positions within salary grade 3 include Cleaning 1, 2, ; Disassembly 1, 2, Assembly 1, 2; Machining 1, 2; and Quality 1  Reference other position postings for specific qualifications and physical requirements  Utilize various computer systems including email on a regular basis.  All operators will adhere to Built in Safety guidelines.  Operator should have attention to detail and be self-motivated.  Operator will work in a team environment.  Operator is expected to cross train in other areas of operations to provide flexibility.  Candidate will work in an environment without close supervision. 
Basic Qualifications

 Basic computer experience (ability to read standard work documents and enter data)  Required to read/write and interpret documents.  Knowledge of engines and components.  Experience with inventory systems 

Top Candidates Will Also Have

 Experience using Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel  Prior use of hoists.  Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills  Previous forklift experience 

Physical Requirements

 Job may be physically demanding at times and must be able to handle high volume fast pace operation.  May work in an environment with frequently changing temperatures  May walk, squat and bend for intervals of 15-30 minutes  Must be able to wear proper PPE.  May require respirator physical and training  May be required to lift/push/pull heavy parts up to 30 lbs. multiple times per shift  Must be able to stand for up to 10+ hours per shift  Must be able to operate at sitting or standing forklift for the duration of shift 

Job Bid Eligibility Requirements

 Any current agency workers applying to this position must have worked the required 60 days to be considered as well as meeting all requirements for the position. 

Additional Information

  Compensation & Benefits Offered!  

Starting hourly pay rate of  $18.80  (pay negotiations based on skills/experience)

Work Hours: 5AM - 3PM; Monday - Thursday

40-hour work weeks with potential for overtime

80 hours of vacation with an additional 24 hours of paid Personal Time Off (PTO)

10 Paid holidays

Climate controlled work environment – most areas

100% 401k match up to 6% offered on day 1 of employment

Health, dental, vision, & life insurance offered on day 1 of employment

Potential annual performance increase

Clean/safe work environment

Paid holiday shut down at the end of the year (dependent upon business needs)

 All eligible candidates MUST pass the following pre-employment screenings before they can be hired to any Caterpillar position: 

 Background Screening  Drug & Alcohol Screening (Applicants are hereby advised that the Company has implemented a drug and alcohol policy and conducts a testing program, pursuant to Sections 71-7-1, et al., of the Mississippi Code of 1972, Ann. (hereinafter referred to as “the Act”), and you are hereby advised of the existence of said Act.)  Post-Offer Medical Questionnaire - clearance from Corporate Medical 

Check out our Caterpillar Remanufacturing facility by clicking the link below:

https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__youtu.be_pv3smO3ZNQ0&d=DwICAg&c=p0oa49nxxGtbbM2qgM-GB4r4m9OlGg-sEp8sXylY2aQ&r=ON4_vAKqSNFJoqNlSFxD-F6sTfx7PfiqfiiLkNcT6zM&m=j3YvN-6M5WATvi1AmLFw8ciQe32e9aIEhJkhYeS_9do&s=I2rtZJxbq9YbRKoMriq3J6xu-iqOJCA6JXkKBcdYTVc&e=

 Please ensure you frequently sign in to your candidate home for any updates or correspondence for positions that you have applied for.   https://cat.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/CaterpillarCareers   . 

  Keep a frequent check on emails as correspondence will be sent to the email that you used to apply with.    If you wish to know the status of your application – please use the candidate log-in on our career website as it will reflect any updates to your status. 

 Visa sponsorship is  NOT  available for this position. 

 This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as, H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S which can be found through our employment website at   www.caterpillar.com/careers 

 Relocation assistance is not offered for this position. Any relocation costs incurred would be the responsibility of the selected applicant. 

About Caterpillar

 Caterpillar Inc. is the world’s leading manufacturer of construction and mining equipment, off-highway diesel and natural gas engines, industrial gas turbines and diesel-electric locomotives. For nearly 100 years, we’ve been helping customers build a better, more sustainable world and are committed and contributing to a reduced-carbon future. Our innovative products and services, backed by our global dealer network, provide exceptional value that helps customers succeed. 

Posting Dates

April 18, 2024 - April 25, 2024

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.

EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community .

Experience Level (if available): None
